item.title: Report E-2024120236
item.description:
Report E-2024120236

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were crushed in transit and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES&H to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all UN1263 from the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120734
item.description:
Report X-2024120734

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: Dayton
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1555
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GATX 88778 was found leaking in the Dayton, TX, Yard. BNSF Contractor SRS was dispatched and found GATX 88778 to be leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). After inspection GATX 88778 was found with the BOV handle open and the secondary closure cap less than tool tight. SRS properly secured the car by closing the BOV handle and properly tool tightening the secondary closure cap. Approximately 1/2 gallon of product released that impacted the ballast.

item.title: Report X-2024120664
item.description:
Report X-2024120664

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-16T12:32:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-05
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the SATR location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six plastic bottles in a plastic bag and the cap was loose on one of the bottles causing the release. The spill agent found a SDS in a packing slip attached to the fiberboard box stating the contents were UN1805 Phosphoric Acid, Solution, 8, III. The shipment was not packaged in UN spec packaging, no DG markings or paperwork required for transport. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and are being held at the location.
